trans-unit.source: Configures the ASP.NET event profiles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `profiles` element of the `healthMonitoring` section of a configuration file.
Event profiles determine how events are collected by ASP.NET and raised to providers.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> class.
using the specified name for the new instance of the class.
The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
Property
Default value
An empty string ("").
<xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.
<xref:System.TimeSpan.Zero>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> object to create.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> class, using specified settings for the new instance of the class.
The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
Property
Default value
An empty string ("").
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> object to create.
The minimum number of event occurrences before the event is raised to the provider.
The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the minimum length of the interval between the times when two events of the same type are raised.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> class, using the specified settings for the new instance of the class.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> object to create.
The minimum number of event occurrences before the event is raised to the provider.
The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the minimum interval between two events of the same type.
The fully qualified type of a custom class that implements <xref href="System.Web.Management.IWebEventCustomEvaluator"></xref>.
Gets or sets the fully qualified type of a custom class that implements the <xref href="System.Web.Management.IWebEventCustomEvaluator"></xref> interface.
The type reference is formed as follows (items in brackets are not required): *Namespace*.*Typename*, *Assemblyname*[,] [Version=x,] [Culture=y,] [PublicKeyToken=z].
For example, "ExampleNameSpace.ExampleType, Example.Assembly, Version=%ASSEMBLY_VERSION%, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=%MICROSOFT_PUBLICKEY%"
The fully qualified type of a custom class that implements the <xref href="System.Web.Management.IWebEventCustomEvaluator"></xref> interface.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This property specifies the maximum number of times an event of the same type will be raised.
For example if the value is `10`, the event will be raised 10 times and ignored thereafter.
The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
The default is <xref href="System.Int32.MaxValue"></xref>.
Gets or sets the minimum number of event occurrences before the event is raised to the provider.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This property specifies the minimum number of times an event occurs before an event is raised to the provider.
For example, a value of `5` means that ASP.NET will not raise an event to the provider until the fifth instance of the event occurs.
If the value is infinite (<xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>), then no event will be raised to the provider.
The minimum number of event occurrences before the event is fired to the provider.
The default is `1`.
Gets or sets the minimum interval between two events of the same type.
The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.
Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
If the value is <xref:System.TimeSpan.Zero>, then there is no minimum interval.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the minimum interval between two events of the same type.
The default is <xref href="System.TimeSpan.Zero"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> object.
A unique name is required.
Duplicate names may result in a loss of data when the configuration section is saved.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings"></xref> object.
The default is an empty string("").
